obedience stick.title: Receive a tool for binding flowers

description: Endoflames and hydroangeas are, ultimately, not very good at generating mana. Using Runes, however, you can make flowers with a stronger bond to nature, which are therefore better at generating - but also more involved to work with. I advise reading these flowers' Lexica entries for full detail.
The Entropinnyum generates mana when in proximity to a nearby **TNT explosion**. Any damage the explosion would cause is nullified, absorbed by the flower and transmuted into the mana you require.

The Gourmaryllis generates mana from **food**. However, you must feed it **a varied diet**, else it will be very displeased and generate only a trickle of mana in defiance. The more varied its diet, the more mana it produces.

The Munchdew **eats leaves** to generate mana. When it is placed near leaf blocks, it will eat all it can find in return for rather a lot of mana - so much so, that it may be ill-advised to use this flower until you can obtain the resources with which to craft more powerful mana spreaders.
The Narslimmus utilizes the strange phenomenon of **slime chunks** to generate mana, granting some every time one of the creatures would spawn.
The Rosa Arcana produces mana from experiences and memories - **experience orbs** of slain creatures, or directly taking experience from people such as yourself standing close enough.

Lastly, the Thermalily uses the volatile energy of **lava** to produce mana. It is, however, not as simple as it may seem: after absorbing a block of lava, the flower **must cool down** for a random time, which can be up to five minutes.
